description: Fantastic. Beats out all other desktop podcast apps.
summary: The desktop podast app you've been looking for

description:
Kasts (on the desktop) is great! I would make this my main podcast app my Kubuntu but for a few things.
1. The 'New Episdoes' list does not seem to populate and this is the default view in Episodes. 'All Episodes' list cannot be set to open as the default. A slight annoyance.
The other issues resolve around the packaging format - the Flatpak does not respect my Kvantum theme and the desktop icon needs to be manually set.
When Kasts releases a deb or Appimage that will respect my theming I will switch to it from Cpod.

I love Kasts, it works perfectly.
It uses PodcastIndex.org so you can search within a 4 millions (and counting!) podcasts catalogue!

Pros - simple interface, ability to search for podcasts, import/export OPML
Cons - unstable on Ubuntu 20.04
summary: Promising app but still a bit rough around the edges

description:
Functions and UI are great on the
Pinephone (Manjaro/Plasma Mobile).
But as soon as the session gets
suspended, the app stops playing.
That makes it hardly usable on the
Pinephone since the screen must
be unlocked every 5 minutes.
summary: Please fix pause at session suspension

description: Perhaps not the best at anything or most visually attractive but it is not the worst either. Most importantly to me at least it is reliable, has a good podcast search facility and allows adding custom feeds and import/export of opml.
Works great to sync with Antennapod on Android through gPodder too.
hay muchas cosas para oir mientras trabajo

Faltaba una aplicación de podcast diseñado para kde con un diseño simple. Algunas pequeñas inconcistencias en elementos de la interfaz pero solucionable. Funciona bastante bien. 
(v.21.07, Flatpak)
